name: EPA: Maximum contaminant level
description: MCLs are standards that are set by the United States Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) for drinking water quality.[1][2] An MCL is the legal threshold limit on the amount of a substance that is allowed in public water systems under the Safe Drinking Water Act (SDWA). The limit is usually expressed as a concentration in milligrams or micrograms per liter of water
